It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Gymnostachyum latifolium is often found in understory habitats of humid forests, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important component of the flora in its native range.
